snippet: The rapid growth in gun sales began after President Obama’s re-election and surged after the Dec. 14 shooting at a school in Newtown, Conn.
abstract: Gun and ammunition sales are spiking nationwide as people rush to expand their arsenals in advance of any restrictions that might be imposed under new White House gun proposals; controversial items like assault rifles and high-capacity magazines are selling at particularly brisk rates.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Kim Severson in Villa Rica, Ga.; Trip Gabriel in New York; Ian Lovett in Simi Valley, Calif.; Campbell Robertson in New Orleans; and Michael D. Shear in Washington.

lead_paragraph: The rapid growth in gun sales began after President Obama’s re-election and surged after the Dec. 14 shooting at a school in Newtown, Conn.

headline.seo: As U.S. Weighs New Rules, Sales of Guns and Ammunition Surge
headline.main: Sales of Guns Soar in U.S. as Nation Weighs Tougher Limits
headline.print_headline: Gun Sales Surge as Nation Weighs Tougher Limits
